pin_cites.parenthetical: "A person producing corporate books and records before a grand jury and giving testimony as to such production is not entitled to immunity under [the prohibition act]. Any testimony auxiliary to such production is unprivileged as are the documents themselves."
"[I]t is generally held in the federal courts that officers of a corporation may be required to produce and identify corporate records even though the records may tend to incriminate them."
